nodes.name: Female 26, Swedish
nodes.des: “It looked like in a hospital movie, with the bright light, the noisy machines and the green covers. It felt real and past the point of no return.”

nodes.name: Female 37, Colombia
nodes.des: “The uncertainty of what was going to happen builded up on the feeling of anxiety and nervous.”

nodes.name: Female 41, Swedish
nodes.des: “I did my first operation in Trelleborg, but just because their process is more like a factory, I choose to do my second one in the smaller hospital where they treated me more as a person.”

nodes.name: Female 28, Swedish
nodes.des: “When I woke up, I was still scared,  So I pulled the tubes out of my nose and needle from my arm three times until I went in peace with the nurse to keep them.”

nodes.name: Male 25, Swedish
nodes.des: “I was feeling very anguish and a bit irritated lying on the OP bed, and I felt the same when I work up. It was like the surgery never happened interms of my emotional state.”

nodes.name: Female 29, Swedish
nodes.des: “I was in a chock when I woke up. I only knew because the pain I was experience was from another universe. I which someone told me before the OP how I would feel.”

nodes.name: Male 32, Swedish
nodes.des: “I was sitting 20 minutes in the waiting room, listening to the pip pf the hospital, people in pain and alarms going of- it did´t make me feel any better.”

nodes.name: Patient
nodes.des: “A hospital alone shows what war is.”

nodes.name: Umeå
nodes.des: University Hospital of Umeå, in Swedish Norrlands universitetssjukhus, is the major hospital in northern Sweden, situated in Umeå.”

nodes.name: Uppsala
nodes.des: Uppsala University Hospital in Uppsala, Sweden is a teaching hospital for the Uppsala University Faculty of Medicine and the Nursing School.”

nodes.name: Hospital
nodes.des: “The key things I learned as a hospital administrator are to be organized, communicate, and be flexible.”

nodes.name: Male 32, Swedish
nodes.des: “It's like an art form- you can perform in many different ways. The act of freedom it´s whats make my job exiting.”

nodes.name: Male 38, Swedish
nodes.des: “What I like with being an anesthesia nurse is that you have a instant feedback of your actions- by watching the patient reaction of your injections.”

nodes.name: Female 41, Swedish
nodes.des: ”I never know how the patient feel afterwards, so its hard to know if I did a good job. It´s like a book you never allowed to finish.”

nodes.name: Female 38, Swedish
nodes.des: “One of the challenges with this profession is the short patient contact, I only have 10-15 minutes to build trust and make the patient feel safe.”

nodes.name: Male 42
nodes.des: “When I was young I used to see eyes, tear, sweat, nails, skin color and lips. When I had access to see. Now, I look at the machine.”

nodes.name: Male 21
nodes.des: “I have a tough schedule and don't get much sleep. On top of that, work gets pretty monotonous when there's not much to do during surgery; its easy to become bored and sleepy.”

nodes.name: Nurse
nodes.des: “Just. Breathe.”

nodes.name: A.Nurse, Female 38, Swedish
nodes.des: “You never fully know what scene you will arrive so I need to be mentally prepared for the anything.”

nodes.name: A.Nurse, Man 47, Swedish
nodes.des: “It´s a challenge to work by my self in small spaces with minimal equipment when the patient are in a critical stage, I always feel like a lack some information”

nodes.name: Ambulance
nodes.des: “Day or night we do it right”

nodes.name: Getinge
nodes.des: “Together we can save more lives”

nodes.name: Shib
nodes.des: “Make intangible tangible”

nodes.name: Martina
nodes.des: “Make invisible visible”

nodes.name: Carolyn
nodes.des: “What can a human do that a machine can't?”

nodes.name: Designer
nodes.des: The interaction designer gives shape to that relation, bringing cognitive, emotional and physical aspects together in a successful whole.

nodes.name: UID
nodes.des: “Shaping the future”

nodes.name: Female, 26, American,Male 42, USA
nodes.des: “The surgeon asked how I felt? I was more concerned how he felt since he´s soon will be cutting into me”

nodes.name: Female 18, Norwegian
nodes.des: “I was scared about not waking up. That they would give me to much drugs because I heard about someone that got crossed eyes because of to big doses.”

nodes.name: Female, 26, American
nodes.des: “I don’t remember what happened; I woke up after surgery very confused. It felt like being drunk in terms of not having control of your mind and body.”

nodes.name: Female, 30, American
nodes.des: “The worst  part were the needles. I hate needles, and it stressed me out. I wish I had been more prepared.”
